Description of incident: Officials from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), which includes the National Weather Service, have notified officials of a data breach to the National Weather Service's satellite network.Reports are stating "hackers from China breached the federal weather network recently, forcing cybersecurity teams to seal off data vital to disaster planning, aviation, shipping and scores of other crucial uses, officials said."It appears the system was affected in September, but officials did not communicate that there was a problem until late October. an NOAA spokesman Scott Smullen did confirm that there were hacks and communicated that "incident response began immediately". More Information: http://www.washingtonpost.com/local/chinese-hack-us-weather-systems-sate...
